Chap. 43 - Miraculous Healing
[THE ITEMS
APPEARING HERE ARE SUPPLEMENTAL TO THE ABUNDANCE
OF COUNSEL ON PRAYER FOR THE SICK. SEE THE
MINISTRY OF HEALING, PP. 225-233; COUNSELS
ON HEALTH, PP. 373-382; MEDICAL MINISTRY,
PP. 195-196; ALSO THE 36-PAGE PAMPHLET, "GUIDING
PRINCIPLES IN PRAYER FOR THE SICK."--COMPILERS.]
-

                A Delicate Situation 

     In regard to the matter of prayer for the sick, many confusing ideas are advanced. One says, "He who has been prayed for must walk out in faith, giving God the glory, and making use of no remedies. If he is at a health institute he should leave it at once."
